==Events==
*[[1138]] &ndash; [[Ly Anh Tong|Lý Anh Tông]] is enthroned as emperor of [[Vietnam]] at the age of two, beginning a 37-year reign.
*[[1499]] &ndash; Publication of the ''[[Catholicon (trilingual dictionary)|Catholicon]]'' in [[Tréguier]] ([[Brittany]]). This Breton-French-Latin dictionary was written in [[1464]] by Jehan Lagadeuc. It is the first Breton dictionary as well as the first French dictionary.
*[[1530]] &ndash; The [[St. Felix's Flood]] destroys the city of [[Reimerswaal (city)|Reimerswaal]] in the [[Netherlands]].
*[[1605]] &ndash; [[Gunpowder Plot]]: [[Guy Fawkes]] is arrested.
*[[1688]] &ndash; [[William III of England]] lands with a Dutch fleet at Brixham, Southwest England.
*[[1757]] &ndash; [[Seven Years' War]]: [[Frederick II of Prussia|Frederick the Great]] defeats the allied armies of [[France]] and the [[Holy Roman Empire]] at the [[Battle of Rossbach]].
*[[1768]] &ndash; [[Treaty of Fort Stanwix]], the purpose of which is to adjust the boundary line between Indian lands and white settlements set forth in the [[Proclamation of 1763]] in the [[Thirteen Colonies]].
*[[1780]] &ndash; French-American forces under [[Augustin de La Balme|Colonel LaBalme]] are defeated by Miami Chief [[Little Turtle]].
*[[1811]] &ndash; Salvadoran priest [[José Matías Delgado]], rang the bells of La Merced church in San Salvador, calling for insurrection and launching the 1811 Independence Movement.
*[[1831]] &ndash; [[Nat Turner]], American slave leader, is tried, convicted, and sentenced to death in [[Virginia]].
*[[1838]] &ndash; The [[Federal Republic of Central America]] begins to disintegrate when [[Nicaragua]] separates from the Federation.
*[[1854]] &ndash; [[Crimean War]]: The [[Battle of Inkerman]].
*[[1862]] &ndash; [[American Civil War]]: [[Abraham Lincoln]] removes [[George B. McClellan]] as commander of the [[Union Army]] for the second and final time.
*  1862   &ndash; [[American Indian Wars]]: In [[Minnesota]], 303 [[Dakota people|Dakota]] warriors are found guilty of [[rape]] and [[murder]] of whites and are sentenced to hang. 38 are ultimately executed and the others reprieved.
*[[1872]] &ndash; [[Women's suffrage in the United States]]: In defiance of the law, suffragist [[Susan B. Anthony]] votes for the first time, and is later fined $100.
*[[1895]] &ndash; [[George B. Selden]] is granted the first U.S. [[patent]] for an [[automobile]].
*[[1911]] &ndash; After declaring war on the [[Ottoman Empire]] on [[September 29]], 1911, [[Italy]] annexes [[Tripoli, Libya|Tripoli]] and [[Cyrenaica]].
*[[1912]] &ndash; [[Woodrow Wilson]] is elected to the presidency of the United States.
*[[1913]] &ndash; King [[Otto of Bavaria]] is deposed by his cousin, Prince Regent Ludwig, who assumes the title [[Ludwig III of Bavaria|Ludwig III]].
*[[1914]] &ndash; [[World War I]]: [[French Third Republic|France]] and the [[British Empire]] declare war on the [[Ottoman Empire]].
*  1914   &ndash; Alpha Phi Delta Fraternity founded at Syracuse University.
*[[1916]] &ndash; The [[Kingdom of Poland (Mitteleuropa)|Kingdom of Poland]] is proclaimed by the [[Act of November 5th]] of the emperors of [[Germany]] and [[Austria-Hungary]].
*  1916   &ndash; The [[Everett Massacre]] takes place in [[Everett, Washington]] as political differences lead to a shoot-out between the [[Industrial Workers of the World]] organizers and local police.
*[[1917]] &ndash; [[October Revolution]]: In [[Tallinn]], [[Estonia]], [[Communist]] leader [[Jaan Anvelt]] leads revolutionaries in overthrowing the [[Russian Provisional Government, 1917|Provisional Government]] (As Estonia and Russia are still using the [[Julian Calendar]], subsequent period references show an October 23 date).
*  1917   &ndash; [[Tikhon of Moscow|St. Tikhon of Moscow]] is elected the [[Patriarch of Moscow]] and of the [[Russian Orthodox Church]].
*[[1925]] &ndash; [[Secret agent]] [[Sidney Reilly]], the first "super-spy" of the 20th century, is executed by the [[State Political Directorate|OGPU]], the [[secret police]] of the [[Soviet Union]].
*[[1937]] &ndash; [[Adolf Hitler]] holds a secret meeting and states his plans for acquiring "[[lebensraum|living space]]" for the German people.
*[[1943]] &ndash; [[World War II]]: [[Bombing of the Vatican]].
*[[1945]] &ndash; [[Colombia]] joins the [[United Nations]].
*[[1950]] &ndash; [[Korean War]]: British and Australian forces from the [[27th British Commonwealth Brigade]] successfully halted the advancing Chinese [[117th Division (People's Republic of China)|117th Division]] during the [[Battle of Pakchon]].
*[[1955]] &ndash; After being destroyed in World War II, the rebuilt [[Vienna State Opera]] reopens with a performance of [[Ludwig van Beethoven|Beethoven]]'s ''[[Fidelio]]''.
*[[1967]] &ndash; The [[Hither Green rail crash]] in the [[United Kingdom]] kills 49 people.  Survivors include [[Robin Gibb]] of the [[Bee Gees]].
*[[1970]] &ndash; [[Vietnam War]]: The [[United States]] Military Assistance Command in [[Vietnam]] reports the lowest weekly American soldier death toll in five years (24).
*[[1983]] &ndash; [[Byford Dolphin]] diving bell accident kills five and leaves one severely injured.
*[[1986]] &ndash; {{USS|Rentz|FFG-46|6}}, {{USS|Reeves|DLG-24|6}} and {{USS|Oldendorf|DD-972|6}} visit [[Qingdao]] (Tsing Tao) [[People's Republic of China|China]] – the first US Naval visit to China since 1949.
*[[1987]] &ndash; [[Govan Mbeki]] is released from custody after serving 24 years of a life sentence for terrorism and treason.
*[[1990]] &ndash; Rabbi [[Meir Kahane]], founder of the far-right [[Kach movement]], is [[Assassination of Meir Kahane|shot dead]] after a speech at a [[New York City]] hotel.
*[[1995]] &ndash; [[André Dallaire]] attempts to assassinate Prime Minister [[Jean Chrétien]] of Canada. He is thwarted when the [[Prime Minister]]'s wife locks the door.
*[[1996]] &ndash; [[President of Pakistan|Pakistani President]] [[Farooq Ahmed Khan Leghari]] dismisses the government of [[Prime Minister of Pakistan|Prime Minister]] [[Benazir Bhutto]] and dissolves the [[National Assembly of Pakistan]].
*[[2003]] &ndash; [[Green River Killer]] [[Gary Ridgway]] pleaded guilty to 48 counts of murder.
*[[2006]] &ndash; [[Saddam Hussein]], former president of [[Iraq]], and his co-defendants [[Barzan Ibrahim al-Tikriti]] and [[Awad Hamed al-Bandar]] are sentenced to death in [[Trial of Saddam Hussein|the al-Dujail trial]] for the role in the massacre of the 148 Shi'a Muslims in [[1982]].
*[[2007]] &ndash; [[China]]'s first lunar satellite, [[Chang'e 1]] goes into orbit around the Moon.
*[[2007]] &ndash; [[Android (operating system)|Android]] mobile operating system is unveiled by [[Google]].
*[[2009]] &ndash; [[United States Army|U.S. Army]] Major [[Nidal Malik Hasan]] murders 13 and wounds 32 at [[Fort Hood]], [[Texas]] in the deadliest [[2009 Fort Hood shooting|mass shooting]] at a U.S. military installation.
*[[2013]] &ndash; India launches the [[Mars Orbiter Mission]], its [[List of Solar System probes|first interplanetary probe]].
